|

Overview
--------
Bruty is a python application used to generate a wordlist using a dictionary or a word list.

It requires ``Python 2`` or ``3``.

Generator types
---------------

You can generate a wordlist in 2 ways:

**Mode 1 - Normal permutation** *(permute words between them)*

This is the normal permutation mode and it is used when you insert the argument ``-i`` **OR** ``-w``. You can create a simple wordlist by insert a dictionary or some words.

Example command: ``bruty -w foo bar`` or ``bruty -i input.txt``

|

**Mode 2 - Shuffle permutation** *(permute every '-w words' for every line of '-i input')*

This is the shuffle permutation mode and it is used to merge, or improve, an existing dictionary. You can use it by insert **BOTH** ``-i`` and ``-w``.

Example command: ``bruty -i input.txt -w foo bar``

Usage
-----

Basic command:
::

    $ bruty -o PATH/TO/OUTPUT.txt -w FOO BAR spam eggs
    Bruty: 40/40 [100%] words generated
    $ cat PATH/TO/OUTPUT.txt
    [...]
    spamBAR
    spameggs
    eggsFOO
    eggsBAR
    eggsspam
    FOOBARspam
    FOOBAReggs
    [...]

Additional options:
::

    -o, --ouput PATH/TO/OUTPUT.txt
            Write on file
    -n, --number NUMBER
            Generate a string long maximum N words (default=3)
    -i, --input PATH/TO/INPUT.txt
            Take words from a file
    -w, --words [WORDS ...]
            Take next written words
    --help, --verbose, --quiet, --version

**Warning:** If you need to insert a word like ``-foo``, you can escape ``-`` with ``\\-``.
    Example: ``bruty -w word1 word2 \\-word3 \\-word4``

Installation
------------

Basic steps to install ``bruty``:
::
    
    Python installation (python3 in this case)
    $ apt-get install python3 python3-pip
    
    Clone this repo and run setup.py to install
    $ git clone https://github.com/AlessioDP/bruty/
    $ cd bruty
    $ python3 setup.py install

Examples
--------

``bruty -o dictionary.lst -w net inforge .`` (`Pastebin1 <http://pastebin.com/6hHWtDtm/>`_)

``bruty -o dictionary.lst -2 -w in forge .net`` (`Pastebin2 <http://pastebin.com/S1cgCVv8/>`_)

``bruty -o dictionary.lst -i base.txt -w word4 word5`` (`Pastebin3 <http://pastebin.com/LjPJ74pQ/>`_)
